nodes.text: No, I'm not interested in buying that Charger you're selling for ten million [[DM.BaseDescriptionDefs[LoreCBill],C-Bills]], we don't care if it's a bargain. And I can tell that the PPCs you have pointed at us are just a couple of painted poles attached to that monstrosity you call a DropShip, buster.
Now bugger off, you half-twat! Pirate havens... there's always a scammer or extortionist trying to con you, certain as a [[DM.Factions[faction_Steiner],Steiner]]'s love of their kroners.
Pilot Meyer, according to the screens, some of those DropShips seem to be pretty close, do we need to worry?

Everything is fine, traffic control around these parts seems to be plotting a random course and hoping that no one else had the same idea but that's not unusual. 

For the ones that do get close, I just steer away and that seems to do the trick, except for this guy.
Very well, what about the contact that we're supposed to meet?
We're ready to establish transmission with the surface, just waiting for everyone to report to the bridge.

It's curious that we were required to travel to [[DM.BaseDescriptionDefs[LoreEspia],Espia]] to receive a contract from the Draconis Combine plus the whole recruitment show. 

This planet is notorious for being a pirate haven and the only reason why the Capellan Confederation hasn't cleared it is because it somehow fits [[DM.BaseDescriptionDefs[LoreMaximillianLiao],Maximillian Liao]]'s purposes.

Aren't the Capellans allied with the Dracs and Leaguers now that they signed that treaty? 

Karsptein something?

Yes, the [[DM.BaseDescriptionDefs[LoreConcordOfKapteyn],Kapetyn treaty]], but expecting those three powers to work together against the recent Steiner-Davion [[DM.BaseDescriptionDefs[LoreFedComAccords],alliance]] is a fantasy, at least in this region of space.

Liao and Marik have been at each other's throats for [[DM.BaseDescriptionDefs[LoreThirdAndurienWar],hundreds of years]] and Kurita has no interests on this area, at least that we know of.

From that description it's more likely that the [[DM.Factions[faction_Kurita],Combine]] wants to keep its 'allies' in check.

We're a long way from the Lyran Commonwealth or the Federated Suns for House Kurita to have any long-term interests here.

As long as the pay is good, let [[DM.BaseDescriptionDefs[LoreTakashiKurita],Takashi Kurita]], Maximillian Liao and [[DM.BaseDescriptionDefs[LoreJanosMarik],Janos Marik]] sort out their 'friend' issues the way they like.

We're finally receiving the transmission and whomever it is, they have some big friends out here and by big I mean a Union also in orbit, so they're using one of the larger pirate groups. Sometimes I wish we could get a bigger DropShip; today the showers broke down again right before my turn after waiting in line for an hour.

branches.responseText: Put it on Sumire, let's see who wants to talk to us.

nodes.text: [Screen comes online]

Mercenary company, you have traveled as requested and won the evaluation trial. I am [[DM.BaseDescriptionDefs[LoreTai-i],Tai-i]] Ninyu Kerai, and I'm here representing the [[DM.BaseDescriptionDefs[LoreISF],Internal Security Force]].

Watch your words, Commander {COMMANDER.LastName}.

[[DM.BaseDescriptionDefs[LoreTheDragon],The Dragon]] doesn't need the help of mercenaries, to suggest otherwise would be insulting.
Here we go, shouldn't really expect that the ISF would be different than the rest of the Combine regarding mercenaries.

Commander, please instruct this woman not to speak again during this conversation.

I have no patience for underlings, especially a female for that matter.
[[DM.BaseDescriptionDefs[LoreTai-i],Tai-i]] Kerai, no dishonor intended to you by our crew, we apologize.

branches.responseText: How may we serve the Combine and the ISF?

nodes.text: I have been personally sent here by the ISF's [[DM.BaseDescriptionDefs[LoreSubhashIndrahar],director]] from my current posting at [[DM.BaseDescriptionDefs[LoreMarfik],Marfik]] to give you a mission of the highest sensitivity for the [[DM.BaseDescriptionDefs[LoreTheDragon],Dragon]].

branches.responseText: One that the ISF couldn't do it by itself, so ka?

nodes.text: So desu. Your pronunciation of Japanese is almost insulting, please do not attempt to speak it again.

branches.responseText: Your English is most excellent, Captain Kerai.

nodes.text: You're less [[DM.BaseDescriptionDefs[LoreGaijin],gaijin]] than you seem, Commander. But let's put the pleasant talk aside and get to business.

Years ago, an assassination attempt was made on the life of [[DM.BaseDescriptionDefs[LoreKuritaCoordinator],Coordinator]] Takashi Kurita.

Since then, the ISF has been searching for the ones responsible to restore the proper balance.

However... there are complications since one of those responsible is a member of the Dragon's household.

Since the Coordinator can't be seen taking direct action against one of its kind and the ISF can't act directly, exterior service is required to solve this matter.

branches.responseText: And that is where we can serve the Combine.

nodes.text: Hai, to keep the proper appearances, this has to be done to look as a consequence of unintended violence by mercenaries or pirates. Your orders are to kill this subject of the Draconis Combine while he's in the [[DM.BaseDescriptionDefs[LoreRimwardPeriphery],Rimward Periphery]], where the Coordinator had him banned in the past.

The reason why I've been sent here personally is to ensure the secrecy of this operation. 

Speak of it with anyone else and I'll personally lead the [[DM.BaseDescriptionDefs[LoreDEST],DEST]] squad that will be sent after you. That applies to all of your crew.

Serve the [[DM.BaseDescriptionDefs[LoreTheDragon],Dragon]] well, Commander {COMMANDER.LastName}, for your own sake.

This conversation is over.
[Transmission ends.]

I'm sorry Commander, I had forgotten about how [[DM.Factions[faction_Kuritan],Kuritans]] are so obsessed with hierarchy and their general attitude towards women. 

Which was one of the reasons why my family left to go live in the [[DM.Factions[faction_TaurianConcordat],Concordat]] in the first place.

Quite the insulting bastard, wasn't he? He seemed to take issue with everything.

And Commander, I had no idea you spoke Japanese.

branches.responseText: Just an expression I learned from some past readings, Yang.

nodes.text:
Standard negotiating tactic, make an act of being offended with something you said, regardless of it's true or not, to get the upper hand. 

It's simple manipulation and a matter of countering with the right response.

The XO is correct, however, this message is troubling because it comes from the director of the ISF himself. 

The [[DM.BaseDescriptionDefs[LoreSubhashIndrahar],Smiling One]] likely knows everything about our past, including the presence of Captain Arano and me onboard.

branches.responseText: Which can bring us all sorts of trouble if we refuse this contract.

nodes.text:
From his tone, it didn't seem that we have that option available.

Who is this Kurita noble that we are required to kill?

It isn't specified on the contract, the only indication is that he's currently in [[DM.BaseDescriptionDefs[LoreCrawfordsDelight],Crawford's Delight]], in Canopian space.

It can't be his son [[DM.BaseDescriptionDefs[LoreTheodoreKurita],Theodore]] or any of [[DM.BaseDescriptionDefs[LoreTakashiKurita],Takashi]]'s close family, so it must be a distant relative away from the succession line.
Likely they don't want to take chances for their prey to be forewarned and escape.

That's something that's ticking me.

Why not hire a bounty hunter or an assassin, like the Directorate did to go after the captain, but instead hire us?
We became assassins quite some time ago, Yang, if you haven't noticed.

It's all about appearances. 

Make no mistake, the court at the [[DM.BaseDescriptionDefs[LoreBlackPearl],Black Pearl]] will know the reason why he was killed, but sending foreign mercenaries instead of a [[DM.BaseDescriptionDefs[LoreDEST],DEST]] team shows how disgraceful his actions were.

While Takashi Kurita's hands remain clean in the whole matter. 

It's politics pure and simple.

And this way he can't be personally criticized nor will the whole attempt on his life be more publicized.

It's all about proper balance, or what they consider to be harmonious for their society.

This is insane and contradictory. 

On one hand they want to make an example, on the other they want to keep the matter secret as possible.
And we have to consider that we are also expendable after we do the Dragon's dirty deeds.

Dr. Murad, our employers motives many times are almost as obscure. 

And Yang, yes, it's possible that they get rid of us afterwards to hide the whole matter.

That's a risk we'll have to take, although the Combine also takes honor matters quite seriously and for the ISF's director to send a personal envoy is also a message of its own.

I'd recommend we take this contract, Kamea. We could use friends in high places and while House Kurita isn't known to treat mercenaries well, we're dealing with a power player here and this could open future opportunities for us.

Very well, Commander {COMMANDER.LastName} please set a course for [[DM.Factions[faction_MagistracyOfCanopus],Canopian]] space. 

We have a Kuritan noble to kill.
